Questions: Explain how hydraulics work on a machine
Answers: Using a incompressible fluid machines use hydraulics to transmit force from one point to another. In most cases, this increases the force applied at one end for a given amount of effort.

Questions: What is a process flow diagram?
Answers: Commonly used in chemical and process engineering. A process flow diagram (PFD) is a diagram that is used to indicate the general flow of equipment and plant processes.

Questions: What is the difference between a strut and a column?Â
Answers: A Column is always vertical but a strut could carry an axial compressive load in any direction. A strut and column both carry the compressive load.

Questions: Describe the difference between a tube and a pipe
Answers: Pipes are always round while tubes can come in different shapes such as rectangular, square, or cylindrical.
